problem.markdown:
What is the order of growth of our countChange function? ( ) Linear ( ) Logarithmic ( ) Quadratic (x) Exponential
[explanation] If we look at the tree that visually explains countChange, we can observe that the function has to count all valid possibilities. By adding 1 to the input value, the function does not simply have to make one more addition of a penny; it has to try all different coins. [explanation]
problem.p: What is the order of growth of our countChange function?

div.p: If we look at the tree that visually explains countChange, we can observe that the function has to count all valid possibilities. By adding 1 to the input value, the function does not simply have to make one more addition of a penny; it has to try all different coins.
